Label: Study Identifier
Notes: Unique identifier for a study.

Label: Domain Abbreviation
Notes: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.

Label: Unique Subject Identifier
Notes: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.

Label: Sponsor Device Identifier
Notes: Sponsor-defined identifier for the device. It must be unique for each tracked unit of the device under study, and can be at whatever level of granularity the device should be identified (e.g., model or serial number, or combination of identifiers).

Label: Sequence Number
Notes: Sequence Number given to ensure uniqueness of device records within subject records within a domain. May be any valid number. It should be unique within every subject/device combination.

Label: Group ID
Notes: Identifier that ties together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject. For example, if a device is inserted that delivers radiation, DXGRPID could be used to tie the records for the device and the radiation together for each course of therapy.

Label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
Notes: Sponsor-defined reference number. Examples: a number pre-printed on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or record identifier defined in the sponsor's operational database.

Label: Name of Device Exposure or Output
Notes: Name of the device or the exposure outputs that are delivered or administered via the device. This should match the definitions as described in the trial summary domain and/or the protocol. Example: "coronary stent", "extracorporeal shock wave treatment", "hyaluronic acid".

Label: Category for Device Exposure
Notes: Used to define a category of device exposures. For example, for a subject who had radiation delivered through an implanted catheter, DXCAT could be used to group the radiation records versus the catheter records.

Label: Subcategory for Device Exposure
Notes: A further categorization of device exposures. If DXCAT captures the radiation versus catheter records (see DXCAT), then DXSCAT might capture the type of catheter if more than one was used.

Label: Exposure per Administration
Notes: Amount of DXTRT administered/delivered per administration. Dose if captured as a numeric value. Dose should only appear once in DXDOSE, DXDOSTXT, or DXDOSTOT.

Label: Device Exposure Description
Notes: Exposure amount or a range of exposure information collected in text form. Units may be stored in DXDOSU. Example: 200-400, 15-20. Dose should only appear once in DXDOSE, DXDOSTXT, or DXDOSTOT.

Label: Device Exposure Units
Notes: Units for DXDOSE, DXDOSTXT, and DXDOSTOT. Examples: "pulses", "ml".

Label: Device Exposure Frequency per Interval
Notes: Exposure frequency per interval. Usually expressed as the number of repeated administrations of DXDOSE within a specific time period. Examples: "CONTINUOUS", "PRN", "Q2M" (every 2 months).

Label: Total Daily Device Exposure
Notes: Total daily exposure of DXTRT using the units in DXDOSU. Total exposure over a period other than day could be recorded in a separate Supplemental Qualifier variable.

Label: Intended Device Exposure Regimen
Notes: Text description of the (intended) schedule or regimen for the Intervention. Examples: "TWO WEEKS ON, TWO WEEKS OFF".

Label: Route of Administration
Notes: Route of administration for DXTRT. Examples: "EXTRACORPOREAL", "INTRA-ARTICULAR, HEMODIALYSIS".

Label: Location of Device Exposure
Notes: Anatomic location of exposure. Examples: "Knee", "Eye".

Label: Laterality of Device Exposure
Notes: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing laterality. Examples: "RIGHT", "LEFT", "BILATERAL".

Label: Reason for Exposure Adjustment
Notes: Describes reason why the exposure was adjusted from protocol-specified or expected exposure levels. Example: "PAIN".

Label: Start Date/Time of Device Exposure
Notes: Start date and time of exposure. Defined by the sponsor.

Label: End Date/Time of Device Exposure
Notes: End date and time of exposure. Defined by the sponsor.

Label: Study Day of Start of Device Exposure
Notes: Study day of start of exposure relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC.

Label: Study Day of End of Device Exposure
Notes: Study day of end of exposure relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC.

Label: Duration of Device Exposure
Notes: Collected duration for a treatment episode. Used only if collected on the CRF and not derived from start and end date/times.

Label: Study Identifier
Notes: Unique identifier for a study.

Label: Domain Abbreviation
Notes: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.

Label: Unique Subject Identifier
Notes: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product. Expected rather than required because events may happen to or with a device that do not involved subjects, and may even be before the device was in contact with a subject. In these cases there may not be a value for USUBJID.

Label: Sponsor Device Identifier
Notes: Sponsor-defined identifier for the device. It must be unique for each tracked unit of the device under study, and can be at whatever level of granularity the device should be identified (e.g., model or serial number, combination of identifiers).

Label: Device Events Sequence Number
Notes: Sequence Number given to ensure uniqueness of device records within subject records within a domain. May be any valid number. It should be unique within every subject/device combination. If there is no USUBJID associated with the event, DESEQ should be unique within each SPDEVID.

Label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
Notes: Sponsor-defined reference number. Perhaps pre-printed on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database. Note that it does not have to be numeric.

Label: Reported Term for Device Event
Notes: Verbatim name of the observed event. Examples: "Screw Breakage", "Fissure Formation", "Battery Issue".

Label: Modified Device Event Name
Notes: The modified text for DETERM. If DETERM is modified, then the modified text is placed here.

Label: Device Events Dictionary-Derived Term
Notes: Dictionary-derived form of the event described in DETERM. Dictionary-derived text description of DETERM or DEMODIFY. The name and version of the dictionary used to map terms must be provided in a Define.XML ExternalCodeList element.

Label: Category of Device Event
Notes: Used to define a categorization level for events. For example, "MALFUNCTION" vs. "CALIBRATION".

Label: Subcategory of Device Event
Notes: Used to define a further category level for events. For example, "EXTERNAL" vs. "INTERNAL".

Label: Pre-Specified Device Event
Notes: Used to indicate whether (Y/null) information about a specific event was solicited on the CRF. For example, DETERM could contain a list of malfunctions that are being specifically evaluated. DEPRESP would identify those (Y), whereas any spontaneous events would have DEPREST null.

Label: Device Event Occurrence
Notes: When information about specific events is solicited, DEOCCUR is used to indicate whether or not (Y/N) a particular pre-specified event occurred. Values are null for events not specifically solicited.

Label: Device Event Collection Status
Notes: The status indicates that the pre-specified question was not answered. For example, if equipment operation requires checking, such as checking an event log to detect events. Capturing that the checks were not completed may be relevant to interpreting the study data.

Label: Reason Device Event Not Collected
Notes: Reason DESTAT was "NOT DONE". This variable should only be used if there are pre-specified events.

Label: Device Event Severity
Notes: Describes the severity of the event, (e.g, the severity of a malfunction).

Label: Action Taken with Device
Notes: Describes Action Taken with respect to the device. Action Taken may include removal, calibration, reprogramming, and so on. Action is usually in response to some event, for example, a subject's adverse event.

Label: Visit Number
Notes: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.

Label: Visit Name
Notes: Protocol-defined description of clinical encounter. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY.

Label: Planned Study Day of Visit
Notes: Planned study day of the visit based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics. This value is usually derived.

Label: Date of Device Event Data Collection
Notes: Date the device event information was collected. This may be reported if the event (e.g., malfunction) is discovered on a different date from the event.

Label: Start Date/Time of Device Event
Notes: Start date/time of the device event. If the event happened at a single point in time, DESTDTC is used.

Label: End Date/Time of Device Event
Notes: End date/time of the device event. If an event lasted over a period of time, DEENDTC can be used to capture the end date/time.

Label: Study Day of Start of Tracking Event
Notes: Study day of Device Event observation, measured as integer days. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in Demographics.

Label: Study Day of Device Event Start
Notes: Study day of start of Device Event, measured as integer days. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in Demographics.

Label: Study Day of Device Event End
Notes: Study day of end of Device Event, measured as integer days. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFENDTC variable in Demographics.

Label: Study Identifier
Notes: Unique identifier for a study.

Label: Domain Abbreviation
Notes: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.

Label: Sponsor Device Identifier
Notes: Sponsor-defined identifier for the device. It must be unique for each tracked unit of the device under study, and can be at whatever level of granularity the device should be identified (e.g., model or serial number, combination of identifiers).

Label: Sequence Number
Notes: Sequence Number given to ensure uniqueness of device records within subject records (if applicable) within a domain. May be any valid number. Should be unique within each SPDEVID.

Label: Reported Term for the Tracking Event
Notes: Verbatim or preprinted term for the activity that occurs. Example: "Shipped", "Returned", "Installed", "Implanted", "Explanted".

Label: Modified Reported Term
Notes: Modified term entered to allow mapping of verbatim term to dictionary term. If DTTERM is modified to facilitate coding, then DTMODIFY will contain the modified text.

Label: Standardized Tracking Term
Notes: Dictionary-derived text description of DTTERM or DTMODIFY. If an external controlled terminology is used, the name and version of the dictionary used to map terms must be provided in a Define-XML ExternalCodeList element.

Label: Category for Device Tracking Event
Notes: Defines a categorization level for a group of related records. Examples: categorize by tracking event type (e.g., "DOMESTIC" vs. "INTERNATIONAL").

Label: Subcategory for Device Tracking Event
Notes: Defines a further categorization level for a group of related conditions or events.

Label: Party Responsible for the Device
Notes: Person or organization accountable for the device at the conclusion of the action specified in DTTERM. Describes the person or organization that is accountable for the device defined in DTTERM. For example, if DTTERM=SHIPPED, DTPARTY would contain the transfer recipient (e.g., SITE). If DTTERM=IMPLANTED, DTPARTY would contain SUBJECT.

Label: Responsible Party Identifier
Notes: An identifier for the responsible group/role (e.g. site, subject). The value of the responsible party identified in DTPARTY. For example, if DTPARTY is SUBJECT, DTPRTYID would contain the subject number.

Label: Date/Time of Tracking Event Collection
Notes: Date/Time the tracking event information was collected. Will generally be the same as the date the tracking event started, but it can differ.

Label: Start Date/Time of Tracking Event
Notes: Start date/time of tracking event. A tracking event (e.g., SHIPPED, RECEIVED) is usually a point in time, which is why only the start date/time is included. If an event occurs over a longer period, the stop date/time may be included from the SDTM model.

Label: Study Identifier
Notes: Unique identifier for a study.

Label: Domain Abbreviation
Notes: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.

Label: Unique Subject Identifier
Notes: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product. Expected in this domain as devices may have settings or uses that either may not involve subjects (e.g., diagnostic tools) or devices that are removed from the study prior to contact with a subject (e.g., device has malfunction).

Label: Sponsor Device Identifier
Notes: Sponsor-defined identifier for the device. It must be unique for each tracked unit of the device under study, and can be at whatever level of granularity the device should be identified (e.g., model or serial number, or combination of identifiers).

Label: Sequence Number
Notes: Sequence Number given to ensure uniqueness of device records within subject records within a domain. May be any valid number. It should be unique within every subject/device combination.

Label: Group ID
Notes: Identifier for a group or block of related records. Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject or a group of subject related records (e.g., group records specifying all the settings for a specific imaging scan, such as field strength, repetition time and echo time).

Label: Reference ID
Notes: Internal or external identifier. This could be a scan code or equivalent.

Label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
Notes: Sponsor-defined reference number. Perhaps pre-printed on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database.

Label: Device-In-Use Test Short Name
Notes: Short name of the measurement, test, or examination described in DUTEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in DUTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST"). DUTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: "COILSTR", "CNTMEDIA".

Label: Device-In-Use Test Name
Notes: Verbatim name of the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding. The value in DUTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples: "Coil Strength", "Contrast Media".

Label: Category for Device-In-Use
Notes: Defines a category of related records. It can be used to define the type of device for which settings are recorded if DI is not used (e.g., if the device is not under study); may also be used to record the type of setting (e.g., "HARDWARE" vs. "SOFTWARE").

Label: Subcategory for Device-In-Use
Notes: A further categorization of a measurement or examination. For example, if DUCAT = "SOFTWARE", DUSCAT might be "NOMINAL" or "POST-ADJUSTMENT".

Label: Result or Finding in Original Units
Notes: Result of the measurement as originally received or collected. DUORRES should contain the setting or other device condition in effect at the time the device was used.

Label: Original Units
Notes: Original units in which the data were collected. The unit for DUORRES. Examples: Tesla, mm.

Label: Result or Finding in Standard Format
Notes: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from DUORRES in a standard format or standard units. DUSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in DUSTRESN. For example, if a test has results "NONE," "NEG," and "NEGATIVE" in DUORRES, and these results effectively have the same meaning, they could be represented in standard format in DUSTRESC as "NEGATIVE".

Label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
Notes: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format. Copied in numeric format from DUSTRESC. DUSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.

Label: Standard Units
Notes: Standardized unit used for DUSTRESC and DUSTRESN. The unit for standardized results may or may not be the same as for the original results.

Label: Visit Number
Notes: A clinical encounter number. A Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.

Label: Visit Name
Notes: Protocol-defined description of clinical encounter. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY.

Label: Planned Study Day of Visit
Notes: Planned study day of the visit based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics. This value is usually derived.

Label: Date/Time Device Used with Test/ Setting
Notes: Date/time that the device was used with this setting. This is not the date/time that the setting was set on the device, but rather that date/time that a measurement or test was done using that setting.

Label: Study Day of Observation
Notes: Study day of Device-In-Use measurement, measured as integer days. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in Demographics.

Label: Study Identifier
Notes: Unique identifier for a study.

Label: Domain Abbreviation
Notes: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.

Label: Sponsor Device Identifier
Notes: Sponsor-defined identifier for the device. It must be unique for each tracked unit of the device under study, and can be at whatever level of granularity the device should be identified (e.g., model or serial number, combination of identifiers).

Label: Sequence Number
Notes: Sequence Number given to ensure uniqueness of device records within subject records within a domain. May be any valid number. It should be unique within every subject/device combination.

Label: Group ID
Notes: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a device.

Label: Reference ID
Notes: Internal or external identifier. This could be a scan code or equivalent.

Label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
Notes: Sponsor-defined reference number.

Label: Device Property Short Name
Notes: Short name of the measurement, test, or examination described in DOTEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in DOTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST"). DOTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: "SHLFLIFE", "INDC", "COMPOS".

Label: Device Property Test Name
Notes: Verbatim name of the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding. The value in DOTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples: "Shelf Life", "Indication for use", "Composition" (of device).

Label: Category for Device In-Use
Notes: Defines a category of related records. For example, it can be used to define the type of property being defined, such as "DIMENSIONS" versus "MATERIAL".

Label: Subcategory for Device In-Use
Notes: A further categorization of a measurement or examination. For example, if DOCAT = "DIMENSION", DOSCAT might be "LENGTH" or "WIDTH" or "THICKNESS".

Label: Result or Finding in Original Units
Notes: Result of the Device Property as originally observed or collected. DOORRES should contain the result or value of the property defined in DOTEST. For example, if DOTEST is LIFE (shelf life), then DOORRES might be 6 (months).

Label: Original Units
Notes: Original units in which the data were collected. The unit for DOORRES. Examples: "MONTHS", "cm".

Label: Study Identifier
Notes: Unique identifier for a study.

Label: Domain Abbreviation
Notes: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.

Label: Unique Subject Identifier
Notes: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product. Required, as the purpose of this domain is to link each USUBJID to one or more devices.

Label: Sponsor Device Identifier
Notes: Sponsor-defined identifier for the device. It must be unique for each tracked unit of the device under study, and can be at whatever level of granularity the device should be identified (e.g., model or serial number, combination of identifiers) as defined in DI.

Label: Study Identifier
Notes: Unique identifier for a study.

Label: Domain Abbreviation
Notes: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.

Label: Sponsor Device Identifier
Notes: Sponsor-defined identifier for the device. It must be unique for each tracked unit of the device under study, and can be at whatever level of granularity the device should be identified (e.g., model or serial number, combination of identifiers).

Label: Sequence Number
Notes: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness within a parameter within a device (SPDEVID) within dataset. If there is only one value for DIPARMCD for each value of SPDEVID, then DISEQ will be 1 for all records. DISEQ must be a valid number.

Label: Device Identifier Element Short Name
Notes: Short name of the identifier characteristic of the device (e.g., "SERIAL", "MODEL"). A record with DIPARMCD = "DEVTYPE" should be included (see below).

Label: Device Identifier Element Name
Notes: Name of the identifier characteristic of the device. Examples: Serial Number, Model. A record with DIPARM = "DEVTYPE" should be included (see below).

Label: Device Identifier Element Value
Notes: Value for the parameter. Value for the parameter. When DIPARMCD=DEVTYPE it should use controlled terminology defined by FDA in their Preferred Term codelist. FDA has stated a preference for the Global Medical Device Nomenclature (GMDN), but as of the date of this publication, the GMDN is not freely available to the public. In its Unique Device Identification rule, FDA indicated that GMDN will not be required unless it is available to the public at no cost. There is a lookup tool on the FDA website to map GMDN codes to FDA PT codes.
